title: Our beauty editor's 8 best new luxury perfumes to invest in now
text:
It’s been a long time since perfumes were so bold and brazen. In the 80’s and early nineties, power scents like Christian Dior’s Poison, Frederic Malle’s Portrait of a Lady and Thierry Mugler’s Angel were as common as shoulder pads and vermillion eyeshadow.

Yet, while most of us have acquired quieter fashion and fragrance tastes since then, it’s finally time to rethink your usual perfume for one with a bit more grit, for there’s a new tribe of power perfumes hitting the fragrance scene that promise to make Joan Collins look like a minimalist.

Besides, with the palava of Brexit, Trump and the bleak British weather to contend with, I for one could do with the confidence-promoting power of musk,...
